data.title: Tribute to Steve Jobs in front of his Palo Alto Home
data.meta_description: Many notes, flowers and apples are left in honor of Steve Jobs in front of his Palo Alto home. The computer entrepreneur and co-founder of Apple died on October 5, 2011. My life has been touched by him, especially during the last year, as I have been enjoying my Apple laptop a lot, and now I bought an i Pad to give to my mother for her 80th birthday. Then we can skype :) May his soul be at peace, and his family be at peace. "Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma — which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow already know what you truly want to become." —Steve Jobs, from www.LivingCompassion.org
data.text:
Many notes, flowers and apples are left in honor of Steve Jobs in front of his Palo Alto home. The computer entrepreneur and co-founder of Apple died on October 5, 2011. My life has been touched by him, especially during the last year, as I have been enjoying my Apple laptop a lot, and now I bought an i Pad to give to my mother for her 80th birthday. Then we can skype :)

May his soul be at peace, and his family be at peace.

"Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma — which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow already know what you truly want to become."

—Steve Jobs, from www.LivingCompassion.org
